de.Lathanael.BinaryFileDB.BaseClass
Class BaseRecordsFile

java.lang.Object
  de.Lathanael.BinaryFileDB.BaseClass.BaseRecordsFile
Direct Known Subclasses:
RecordsFile
public abstract class BaseRecordsFile
extends java.lang.Object

Abstract class providing basic functions to create low-level binary file database.

Author:
original by: Derek Hamner (http://www.javaworld.com/javaworld/jw-01-1999/jw-01-step.html?page=1), modified by: Lathanael (aka Philippe Leipold)

Field Detail

dataStartPtr

protected long dataStartPtr
Current file pointer to the start of the record data.

FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH

protected final int FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH
Total length in bytes of the global database headers.

Default value: 16

RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH

protected final int RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH
Number of bytes in the record header.

Default value: 16

MAX_KEY_LENGTH

protected final int MAX_KEY_LENGTH
The length of a key in the index.

Default value: 64

INDEX_ENTRY_LENGTH

protected final int INDEX_ENTRY_LENGTH
The total length of one index entry - the key length plus the record header length.

Default value: MAX_KEY_LENGTH + RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH = 80

NUM_RECORDS_HEADER_LOCATION

protected final long NUM_RECORDS_HEADER_LOCATION
File pointer to the num records header.

Default value: 0

See Also:
Constant Field Values

DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION

protected final long DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION
File pointer to the data start pointer header.

Default value: 4

Constructor Detail

BaseRecordsFile

protected BaseRecordsFile(java.lang.String dbPath,
                          int initialSize)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          RecordsFileException
Creates a new database file, initializing the appropriate headers. Enough space is allocated in
the index for the specified initial size.

Parameters:
dbPath - - Pathname where the file is located as a String
initialSize - - Size of the db created
Throws:
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException

BaseRecordsFile

protected BaseRecordsFile(java.lang.String dbPath,
                          int initialSize,
                          int MAX_KEY_LENGTH,
                          int DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION,
                          int FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH,
                          int RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          RecordsFileException
Creates a new database file, initializing the appropriate headers. Enough space is allocated in
the index for the specified initial size. The user can define the lenghts of key, header etc!

Parameters:
dbPath - - Pathname where the file is located as a String
initialSize - - Size of the db created
MAX_KEY_LENGTH - - MAX_KEY_LENGTH
DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION - - DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION
FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH - - FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH
RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH - RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH
Throws:
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException

BaseRecordsFile

protected BaseRecordsFile(java.lang.String dbPath,
                          java.lang.String accessFlags)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          RecordsFileException
Opens an existing database file and initializes the dataStartPtr. The accessFlags
parameter can be "r" or "rw" -- as defined in RandomAccessFile.

Parameters:
dbPath - - Pathname where the file is located as a String
accessFlags - - Whether the new DBFile should hava read-only "r" or read/write "rw" access
Throws:
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException

BaseRecordsFile

protected BaseRecordsFile(java.lang.String dbPath,
                          java.lang.String accessFlags,
                          int MAX_KEY_LENGTH,
                          int DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION,
                          int FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH,
                          int RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH)
                   throws java.io.IOException,
                          RecordsFileException
Opens an existing database file and initializes the dataStartPtr. The accessFlags
parameter can be "r" or "rw" -- as defined in RandomAccessFile. Lets the user define the
lengths of key, header etc.

Parameters:
dbPath - - Pathname where the file is located as a String
accessFlags - - Whether the new DBFile should hava read-only "r" or read/write "rw" access
MAX_KEY_LENGTH - - MAX_KEY_LENGTH
DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION - - DATA_START_HEADER_LOCATION
FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH - - FILE_HEADERS_REGION_LENGTH
RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH - RECORD_HEADER_LENGTH
Throws:
java.io.IOException
RecordsFileException

getIndexAt

protected abstract IndexEntry getIndexAt(long targetFp)
                                  throws RecordsFileException
Returns the record to which the target file pointer belongs - meaning the specified location in the file is part of the record data of the RecordHeader which is returned. Returns null if the location is not part of a record. (O(n) mem accesses)

Throws:
RecordsFileException

updateRecord

public void updateRecord(RecordWriter rw)
                  throws RecordsFileException,
                         java.io.IOException
Updates an existing record. If the new contents does not fit in the original record, then the update is handled by deleting the old record and adding the new.

Throws:
RecordsFileException
java.io.IOException

readRecordData

protected byte[] readRecordData(IndexEntry entry)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Reads the record data for the given record header.

Throws:
java.io.IOException

writeRecordData

protected void writeRecordData(IndexEntry entry,
                               RecordWriter rw)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               RecordsFileException
Updates the contents of the given record. A RecordsFileException is thrown if the new data does not fit in the space allocated to the record. The header's data count is updated, but not written to the file.

Throws:
RecordsFileException
java.io.IOException

writeRecordData

protected void writeRecordData(IndexEntry entry,
                               byte[] data)
                        throws java.io.IOException,
                               RecordsFileException
Updates the contents of the given record. A RecordsFileException is thrown if the new data does not fit in the space allocated to the record. The header's data count is updated, but not written to the file.

Throws:
RecordsFileException
java.io.IOException

deleteRecord

public void deleteRecord(java.lang.String key)
                  throws RecordsFileException,
                         java.io.IOException
Deletes a record.

Throws:
RecordsFileException
java.io.IOException

insureIndexSpace

protected void insureIndexSpace(int requiredNumRecords)
                         throws RecordsFileException,
                                java.io.IOException
Checks to see if there is space for and additional index entry. If not, space is created by moving records to the end of the file.

Throws:
RecordsFileException
java.io.IOException

close

public void close()
           throws java.io.IOException,
                  RecordsFileException
Closes the file.

Throws:
RecordsFileException
java.io.IOException
